title: 20.1 Money problems - tto123
description: Deze les valt onder de arrangeerbare leerlijn van de Stercollectie voor Engels voor tweetalig onderwijs, leerjaar 1, 2 en 3. Dit is thema 4 'Money'. Het onderwerp van deze les is: Money problems. In deze les staat geldproblemen centraal. Daarnaast wordt het onderwerp geld vervalsen en zakgeld behandeld. De onregelmatige werkwoorden in deze les zijn: to hurt, to keep, to know en to lay. In de grammaticaopdracht wordt comparisons (vergelijkingen) behandeld.

items.content:
The subject of this lesson is money problems.

  • Form groups of three or four pupils.

Discuss the following questions in your group:

  • How much pocket money do you get?
  • Do you get enough money?
  • How can you get more money?
  • Write down as many words as you can regarding money.

Step

Activity

Aim

Time

Introduction

Find out what you already know.

10

Let's make lots of money

You can understand a video about forging money and answer questions about it.

15

Step 2

Study shows money makes us worry

You can understand a text about money problems and answer questions about it.

15

Step 3

Vocabulary and irregular verbs

You can understand and use vocabulary about money. The irregular verbs: to hurt, to keep, to know and to lay.

15

Step 4

Grammar
Comparisons

You can understand and use comparisons.

10

Allowances

You can discuss about pocket money.

10

Money problems

You can write an email about money problems.

Reflect on what you have learnt.

5

Step 8

Extra
Money by Abba

items.content:
Study shows money makes us worry

You are going to read a text about money problems.

  • Read the text and do assignment 1.
  • Read the text again and do assignment 2 and 3.

Assignment 1

Copy and fill in the grid (on your own) and discuss the answers in your group.

What information do you get about: (use key words)

subject of the study

women

men

shops

conclusion

A new study from the BBC shows that looking after money isn't easy. Over 109.000 people took part in the BBC's Big Money Test. It was one of the biggest ever studies on the psychology of money. One of the biggest findings is that money makes many people feel bad. Researchers say over 40 per cent of us always worry about spending money; a third of us constantly worry about money; and the same percentage feel guilty when spending money on themselves. The study found that women like to go shopping to make themselves feel better about life, while men are more likely to save their cash. Women are more generous with their money and are also more likely to suffer from money problems.

The researchers also looked at ways shops try and make us spend our money. It showed how stores are continually looking at new ways to make us buy things on impulse. It asks why candies and chocolate are always by the checkout in supermarkets; why "everyday essentials like bread and milk are at the back of shop so you have to walk through as many aisles as possible to reach them;" and why the perfume and jewellery sections are always at the front of a department store.
The test says that buying things on impulse can be bad for our finances: "People who bought goods impulsively were three times more likely to go bankrupt, and four times more likely to run out of money by the end of the week."

Source: www.breakingnewsenglish.com

prompt.body:
Fill in: true or false.

Almost 110.000 people took part in a BBC study on money.

Fill in: true or false.

The BBC research was the biggest everon the psychology of money.

Fill in: true or false.

The research says 40% of us worry about money all the time.

Fill in: true or false.

The researchers said men are more generous than women with money.

Fill in: true or false.

The article says we look for new ways to buy things on impulse.

Fill in: true or false.

The research questions why milk is always at the back of the store.

Fill in: true or false.

The study found impulse buying is not so good on our wallets?

Fill in: true or false.

Impulse buyers are three times likelier to go bankrupt.
What shows that looking after money isn't easy?
How many people participated in the study?
How many of us always worry about spending money?
What percentage of people feel guilty about buying themselves things?
What are women more likely to suffer from?
What are shops continually looking at getting us to do?
What question do the researchers have about candies and chocolate?

content.body: why they are always next to the checkout
why we spend so much on them

prompt.body: What two everyday necessities are mentioned?
What is impulse buying bad for?
What thing are impulse buyers three times more likely to do?

items.content:
• Study the vocabulary (10 minutes).
  • Study the irregular verbs.
  • Do the exercises.

Vocabularylist Money problems

Tip!
There are many ways to work on your vocabulary in Wozzol.
You can say or copy the words out loud.
Click in Wozzol on the red arrow for the different options.
The most important thing is that you don't do this for too long, because then you don't learn anything anymore.
In two 10-minute sessions you learn more than in half an hour.

Irregular Verbs

Check out the knowledge base below and study the following irregular verbs:

  • to hurt
  • to keep
  • to know
  • to lay
Irregular verbs

content.body:
Fill in the correct word.
Choose from: bankrupt ♦ checkout ♦ feel bad ♦ forge ♦ grand ♦ note ♦ saving my cash ♦ spending money ♦ tenner

  1. Dad, have you got a for me, I'm going to the mall.
  2. I really shouldn't be right now.
  3. I should be to buy a new mobile phone.
  4. I shouldn't have spent my last 5 pound on candy.
  5. Not having enough money makes me .
  6. I could always try to some money.

1. tenner
2. spending money
3. saving my cash
4. note
5. feel bad
6. forge

Fill in the correct form of the irregular verb.

  1. to know I'm sorry but I don't the answer to this question.
  2. to hurt Can you tell me where it ?
  3. to keep She didn't know where he his money.
  4. to lay Our chicken has a lot of eggs.

Comparisons

  • Study the theory.
  • Do assignment 1.
Adjectives and adverbs

items.content:
Discuss the following questions in your group:

  1. Do your parents give you an allowance (pocket money)?
  2. What do you use it for?
  3. How often do they give it to you?
  4. How long does it last?
  5. Is it large enough?
  6. When do you get it?
  7. Do you have to do something in return? If so, what? Is it fair?
  8. Does it pay your phone bill?
  9. Do you have to buy your clothes with your allowance?

You are going to write an email about money problems.

  • First read the assignment and write the email on your own.
  • Compare your emails in your group.
  • As a group, write an email to hand in to your teacher.

Assignment

You are going to write an email to your pen pal in England.

  • Begin your email by greeting your friend. (Think of a name).
  • You are going to write about your pocket money.
  • Describe a problem about your pocket money. (Think of something)
  • Ask for advice.
  • Ask your pen pal about his/her pocket money.
  • Think of something else to ask your pen pal.
  • Finish your email.

Ask your teacher how many words you have to use.

Fill in the schedule and answer the questions below.

Activity

Fun

Boring

Easy

Hard

I already know this

New

Listening

Reading

Vocabulary

Grammar

Speaking

Writing

What have you learnt in this period?
Answer the following questions:

  • What was the easiest part of this lesson?
  • What did you already know?
  • What was the most difficult part?
  • What was new to you in this lesson?
  • What do you have to ask your teacher?

Extra: Money by Abba

Have you got time left? Watch this!

You have watched and listened to the song 'Money' by Abba.

  • Now read the statements.
  • Watch the video.
  • Do the exercises.

Read the statements.

  1. The girl in this song doesn't want to work.
  2. She dreams of having a rich husband.
  3. She hasn't got enough money.
  4. She thinks it's easy to find a rich man.
  5. To get rich she has to go to a casino to gamble.
  6. She doesn't know what to do with a lot of money.

Watch the video again and do the first and second exercise.

prompt.body:

Are the following statements true or false.

She doesn't know what to do with a lot of money.
